comment.author: 21001715@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sitting portraits, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Probably "Lady Lowther, formerly Miss Alice Blight of Philadelphia and wife of the British Ambassador at Constantinople." See query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9402E3D6123BE633A...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A 1920 portrait of Lady Lowther www.npg.org.uk/collections/search/portrait.php?LinkID=mp6... could easily be the same person.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Her engagement was reported by the NYT on Christmas Day 1904. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C05E0DE1631E233A... "The most notable engagement of the week has been that of Miss Alice Atherton Blight to Gerard Lowther. Miss Blight is a statuesque-looking girl, tall and handsome, with superb figure, and of blonde type." They met when he was attached to the British Embassy in Washington. In the summer of 1913 she was in the news for her work as President of the British War Relief Fund supporting refugees and other casualties of the Balkan Wars. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9905E6D71139E633A... "GRATEFUL TO LADY LOWTHER; Sultan Sends Gift to American Wife of British Ambassador." She died at Bournemouth, England on November 20, 1939

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The San Francisco Call, December 23, 1904 has a picture of Alice Blight above the announcement of her engagement. www.loc.gov/chroniclingamerica/lccn/sn85066387/1904-12-23...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks swanq for your great research.   My guess is that this portrait was done before the 1920 portrait in the NPG, based on the date written on the negative.  We'll update her name the next time we edit this record.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Susan Sarandon could have played her in the movie bio . . . ;-)
